result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kegan C. Jackson

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with victim or not to be within 500 feet of victim's residence.  Def. to comply with inpatient treatment and aftercare recommendations.

2:24 p.m./Rm. 301/State by ADA Kelly Hays.  No appearance by Def.  State recommends bond modification to $10,000.00 signature with conditions:  no contact with victim or within 500 feet of victim's residence.  Def. to comply with inpatient treatment and aftercare recommendation.  So ordered.

2:56 PM Defendant Kegan C. Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. qualifies for PD and is still awaiting counsel. Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court will find that there is good cause to go past the time limits via Nhia Lee Standards. State has received communication from Def. agent regarding treatment. State questions if Def. can appear via zoom or phone if in treatment. Court will allow.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:38 PM Defendant Kegan C. Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Court reviews history of case. Status of Counsel report filed. Def. still wants counsel.  Court finds good cause.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:57 PM Defendant Kegan C. Jackson appeared by video, in custody, via zoom.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews history of case. Bond modification request and CC notes is set.  Def. heard on counsel and is eligible for PD.  Def. wants to wait for counsel.  Court heard on Nhia Lee Standards.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:36 PM Defendant Kegan C. Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Request for bail/bond modification. Def. did call PD. State has been in contact with probation agent RE treatment. Bond continues
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

04:16 PM Defendant Kegan C. Jackson in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kegan C. Jackson appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.  Def. is eligible for P.D. Court will adjourn.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with victim including third party and electronically or be within 500 feet of victim's residence.

01:06 PM Room 203  Defendant Kegan C. Jackson in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties via Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. ADA makes statement and recommendation of a cash bond of $2,500 with conditions of no contact with victim or victim's residence. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement and ruling. Court orders a $2,500 cash bond with conditions of no contact with victim including third party and electronically or be within 500 feet of victim's residence. Adjourned Initial Appearance is scheduled on June 6, 2022 at 1:30 PM. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
